Info.Label: Expermental Feature
Info.Description: Generates a metallic map from the input image. A metallic map is utilized in 3D rendering to define areas that should appear metallic. White areas are interpreted as metallic, while black areas are considered non-metallic.

Properties.Name: High-Pass Radius
Properties.Summary: Controls the size of the details targeted by the high-pass filter. A larger radius captures broader details, while a smaller radius focuses on finer details.

Properties.Name: High-Pass Strength
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the influence of the high-pass filter on the map. Increasing the strength makes the targeted details more pronounced, while decreasing it results in subtler details.

Properties.Name: Bias
Properties.Summary: Shifts the overall brightness of the metallic map. A higher bias increases brightness, making more areas appear metallic, while a lower bias darkens the map, reducing the metallic areas.

Properties.Name: Contrast
Properties.Summary: Enhances or reduces the differences between metallic (bright) and non-metallic (dark) areas. A higher contrast creates a more distinct separation between metallic and non-metallic regions, while a lower contrast results in smoother transitions.

Properties.Name: Levels
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the range of brightness values in the metallic map, allowing for fine-tuning the balance between metallic (white), non-metallic (black), and semi-metallic (gray) areas.

Info.Label: Recommendation:
Info.Text: For optimal results, it is recommended to first generate a height map from the base image and then use this height map as the source to generate the metallic map.
